node.title: The Netherlands plans a partial lockdown regardless of vaccination status.
node.alt: Shoppers wearing face masks in Amsterdam this month.
node.description: The country is experiencing rising case numbers amid a fourth wave of infections.
node.content: ["The Netherlands\u2019 government plans to introduce a three-week partial lockdown to quell a fourth wave of Covid infections amid a spike in case numbers, the public broadcaster NOS reported on Friday.", "It is the first recent lockdown affecting all people \u2014 whether vaccinated or not \u2014 in Western Europe, and it comes as the Netherlands registered 16,364 new cases on Thursday. That figure, a level not seen since early in the pandemic, was a 33 percent rise over the new cases registered a week earlier.", "Starting on Saturday, restaurants, bars and cafes in the country will have to close at 7 p.m. Sporting events will be held without spectators. Residents will not be allowed to invite more than four guests into their homes. And social distancing rules will be reinstated, though stores that sell essentials will remain open.", "Prime Minister Mark Rutte and Hugo de Jonge, the health minister, are expected to announce the measures on Friday evening.", "Mr. Rutte\u2019s cabinet will also discuss on Friday whether to introduce longer-term measures that would require people to provide proof of vaccination or past infection to get access to certain services or to participate in certain events.", "About 76 percent of the country\u2019s population is fully vaccinated against the coronavirus, according to Our World in Data."]
